explanation: The report is correct. mhd_assert is defined as a no-op (#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)), so statements like mhd_assert(...); (including the terminal mhd_assert(0); in digest_update, digest_calc_hash, digest_get_size and the checks in calc_userdigest) compile to operations that do nothing. Because they are executed but removing them would not change program behaviour in the non-debug build, they meet the definition of dead code in MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.2. (Note: this is different from unreachable code — these assertions can be reached but are inert in release builds.)
